intro: Codonopsis foetens, commonly known as the stinking codonopsis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant is known for its strong, unpleasant odor, which is particularly noticeable when the flowers are in bloom. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forested areas at high altitudes. The leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
